channel.title: miljko tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from miljko.

item.description: @nntaleb That's‚Ä¶ not how the drug pricing works in the US, unfortunately. I hope we'll have a manuscript out by mid-July to discuss at RWRI, but I can also send you a draft.

If this is true for every RAT, all those preschool/daycare test-to-return and test-to-stay mandates are worse than useless (as anyone who‚Äôs tried do get a nasal swab from a 4 y/o once a week can confirm) https://t.co/jTzYlEuGLp

@barttels2 Just reading about Montaigne on Wikipedia, it‚Äôs hard to believe he was writing in this way more than 4 centuries ago. But not hard at all to realize we learned absolutely nothing from it https://t.co/lywhypcbor https://t.co/QJA3vPjrRA

üìö Re-reading Taleb‚Äôs Fooled by Randomness for the first time since covid hit. From the preface, on intellectual immodesty. There is a direct line from this to the catastrophic early response to the pandemic. BTW, our company is called Cartesian but we are Montaignes at heart. https://t.co/suQppCwmwm
@VPrasadMDMPH "Kinda" crazy? It's bonkers. Grantsmanship should be abolished/made obsolete, not taught.

Hyperprogression in 4 of 12 patients with PTCL treated with nivolumab (3 of those with AITL) https://t.co/0wNEGJ93W3 Fun fact: when we sent data on our 11 patients with TCL to same journal (JITC), sole reviewer‚Äôs one-line review was: too few patients! So, 12 is the magic number!

‚ÄúWhether hot or cold water freezes faster remains unknown.‚Äù Thus begins a wonderful Quanta Magazine article about the ‚ÄúMpemba effect‚Äù, named after a Tanzanian teenager who saw something funny happen to his home-made ice cream. Reality is complicated. https://t.co/UAyfcJKP0z
@Peperom36001888 üéØ

‚ÄúA lot of people simply won‚Äôt read a 15-page whitepaper, but will be impressed by flowcharts. By making the language of Web3 meandering and impenetrable and by building a culture that is very self-referential, investors make criticism harder to come ... https://t.co/dwve2SbI95
@barttels2 Serbian Twitter begs to differ üòÜ
Evo doze zdravog razuma kao antidot nadrilekarskim naklapanjima. https://t.co/CFPwjaMIWX
Krajnje vreme bilo je pre mnogo godina, ali mo≈æe i sad! https://t.co/LZVaHNZEKc

‚ÄúIf you are trying to figure out a thinker and his or her defects, see if you can spot that person‚Äôs ‚Äúonce-and-for-all‚Äù moves. There will be plenty of them.‚Äù Cowen is right, though we can debate wether early closure is a defect or a feature. https://t.co/wTeGXhJnt7
More art deco than brutalism? Yes, please. https://t.co/405lnKEdwT
üçæ https://t.co/q2MBi0FScr

@InstapaperHelp Trying to log in to Instapaper in the iOS Shortcuts app gives me this message. iOS v15.5. No issues with the Instapaper app itself (v8.1.1) or logging in to the website. Thoughts? https://t.co/arAp5b5q6K
Hard to say what‚Äôs better here, the article or the illustrations that accompany it. Good job, FT Magazine. https://t.co/Bf6rKkZeLN https://t.co/G7GWRUO5Dc
All aboard the hype train: https://t.co/5RT0AgVEtd

‚ÄúWhen people stopped smoking, toxic clouds disappeared from indoor spaces like bars, restaurants, and offices. I think something similar would happen if people stopped reading the news, except the detoxified indoor spaces would be our own ... https://t.co/hKhc34jmbG
@dgomezalmaguer ‚ÄúThe future is already here, it‚Äôs just not evenly distributed‚Äù -W. Gibson
@MelanicjMD @NCICCR_Lymphoma @theNCI Hey, congrats! Now how about that paper? :) https://t.co/nX2XJSuyDI

@GuiperiniMD This is misuse of the term ‚Äúabscopal‚Äù. How can they call a response abscopal when they are also giving systemic therapy? At best I would say that RT may be augmenting response to nivo.

PSA: don‚Äôt dig holes in the sand. A few years ago my wife and I finished a Thanksgiving beach outing by helping dig out a kid (not ours!) completely buried after a hole he was in collapsed. He made it out alive, but it was traumatic for everyone involved. https://t.co/tOe4iIWmRZ

The NYT dostarlimab article is reverberating through international media with predictable consequences: being hailed as a miracle cure for cancer. I wrote about it in Serbian, and Google‚Äôs translation of it is readable, in an AI-generated spam sort of way. https://t.co/oHen5h6dBc
https://t.co/xkwQHHZiLO
üôÑ https://t.co/golL9urVYr https://t.co/1BGCoUAK9h
